summary: By midday Hot Pie had begun to complain. His arse was sore, he told them, and the saddle was rubbing him raw inside his legs,...
text:
By midday Hot Pie had begun to complain. His arse was sore, he told them, and the saddle was rubbing him raw inside his legs, and besides he had to get some sleep. “I’m so tired I’m going to fall off the horse.”
Arya looked at Gendry. “If he falls off, who do you think will find him first, the wolves or the Mummers?”
“The wolves,” said Gendry. “Better noses.”
Hot Pie opened his mouth and closed it. He did not fall off his horse.

summary: “I’m Going To Break the Wheel”
body:
“I’m Going To Break the Wheel”

Daenerys in the show is the only person who has vocalized ANY objection to the feudalism that chokes Westeros from any kind of meaningful growth and crushes the smallfolk like bugs.

Even the uwu Starks are fighting for their home, so they can regain their base of power. Northern Independence is giving the Starks more feudal power, not less.

That’s why Daenerys will win in the show. And that’s why she will give up her power, like she did in Meereen, and give it to her people.

That line is there FOR A REASON. That she is the only, ONLY person in the show to vocalize these thoughts, makes her a radical and the only one who should win.

And she will.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Hello! Don't mind me, just doing a bit of advertising 😊
body:
Hello! Don’t mind me, just doing a bit of advertising 😊

Going through some heavy Game of thrones/ Asoif withdrawals and looking to calm the itching cravings and urges until April? Take a chance on my G.o.T/ Asoif fanfic! A new chapter is in the works and you have the chance to join the hype 👍😁

If you ever wondered about Rickard, Brandon and Lyanna Stark and just how Ned grew up to be so close to Robert, I guarantee this fic would give you something to think on. If you ever wondered how Ned would have been if he had a family/ supporter during those years of secrecy about Jon, this fic is totally for you!.

Always believed Robert could have been deeper explored as a character in the books and shows? I do that in this fic! Ever wondered just why Lyanna ran away to Rhaegar? I offer an explanation in this fic! Ever questioned just what Brandon Stark had been like as a person, heir, sibling and what he possibly could have thought about marrying Catelyn!? I did, and I wrote about it in this fic!!

This is not a joke, but a very Serious offer with unlimited access for any and all of you interested!! If you hurry now and get to reading, you’ll be just in time to join the rest of the already waiting readers in receiving the next upcoming chapter!!!

But I do urge you all to hurry now as the next update has been promised to be published in THREE DAYS TIME!! You read it right the first time, A NEW CHAPTER IN THREE DAYS!! This service is also COMPLETELY FREE with no obligations of swearing loyalty, oaths or even spilling blood to prove worth!

“Winter is coming”

and I would to see you arrive with it! Just drop a review if you do read it stating that you discovered it from this Tumble post, and a preferred username, and with the next update I’ll be sure to give you a personalized shout out in my Author note. ✊😉

Here’s the link, available now (and pretty much always)

https://www.fanfiction.net/s/12729519/1/The-Winter-Storm-Queen

summary: I don’t like the Sansa and Arya duo either and I’m an Arya Stan. I like Sansa tho I just don’t feel like their scenes add...
question: I don’t like the Sansa and Arya duo either and I’m an Arya Stan. I like Sansa tho I just don’t feel like their scenes add anything to either character together they usually bore me while I like them separate.
answer: Exactly! We never learn anything new about either character, the dynamic isn’t rich at all. I really don’t get why people are hyped for more scenes. I’d rather both characters interacted with characters that do develop them. It’s the final season, we really don’t have that much left with them which is why I want it even less. Sansa-Arya scenes are a complete waste of time, probably more than Sansa-Bran and Arya-Bran scenes. At least we know Sansa would hand lordship to Bran if D&D didn’t hate him and Arya was given the dagger that almost killed Bran and that finally killed Littlefinger. Worst of all Sophie and Maisie lack chemistry when they are acting opposite each other but not in real life.

summary: That scene where I’m forging the sword, I’m saying that it’s gratuitous, but the idea they wanted to convey was that … it was...
text: That scene where I’m forging the sword, I’m saying that it’s gratuitous, but the idea they wanted to convey was that … it was more for Arya than anything to do with my character. It was them trying to imply that Arya’s becoming a woman now and she’s dealing with feelings that she’s maybe not experienced before.

I'm not too active these days but it's pretty much all Harry Potter/Fantastic Beasts with a lot of The Dragon Prince, Game of Thrones, The Lord of the Rings, Downton Abbey, The Hunger Games, Girl Meets World, Avatar: The Last Airbender, The Legend of Korra and pretty much whatever else I feel like talking about.

summary: Did you see that maisie williams said Arya is asexual? Fuck, man.
question: Did you see that maisie williams said Arya is asexual? Fuck, man.
answer:
Ok, I’ve gotten a couple of asks along these lines so I went and looked up the interview.

It’s understandably disappointing to hear her misinterpret Arya’s character (provided she isn’t joking) but it doesn’t necessarily have to mean anything.

  • She was with Sophie Turner. Those two are notoriously ridiculous when they get together. Sophie added, “With Sansa, [Arya] can get a little kinky.” Sophie had been talking about how Sansa is learning to love herself, so I could see Maisie trying to “one up her.”

  • Actors are sometimes told shit to say to misdirect the audience. I mean, how many times did we hear that “Jon is dead and not coming back.”  Joe has also been digging up that old as dust theory that Gendry is Cersei and Robert’s true born son. Which I guess isn’t completely impossible but I think it’s highly unlikely so I found that a tad suspicious even before Maisie said anything.

  • Being ace doesn’t mean you can’t fall in love/get married. I am ace and I’m in a long term relationship.

  • She might have her own opinion, regardless of whatever happens in season 8.

  • She could be trying to get those who are expecting Gendry and Arya rolling around on the floor of the forge to chill. Haha.

Even ignoring all of the subtext and their past interactions, I still find it very hard to believe they wouldn’t throw something our way. Those spin-offs they’re so desperately pushing require viewers wanting to commit to another several years of heartbreak.

So long as they both survive, I think we’ll at least have room to head canon. I highly doubt they’re gonna have some kind of Harry Potter 19 Years Later epilogue so it’s not like we’re going to find out who gets married and has children together, etc.

Ok, I’ve gotten a couple of asks along these lines so I went and looked up the interview.

It’s understandably disappointing to hear her misinterpret Arya’s character (provided she isn’t joking) but it doesn’t necessarily have to mean anything.

  • She was with Sophie Turner. Those two are notoriously ridiculous when they get together. Sophie added, “With Sansa, [Arya] can get a little kinky.” Sophie had been talking about how Sansa is learning to love herself, so I could see Maisie trying to “one up her.”

  • Actors are sometimes told shit to say to misdirect the audience. I mean, how many times did we hear that “Jon is dead and not coming back.”  Joe has also been digging up that old as dust theory that Gendry is Cersei and Robert’s true born son. Which I guess isn’t completely impossible but I think it’s highly unlikely so I found that a tad suspicious even before Maisie said anything.

  • Being ace doesn’t mean you can’t fall in love/get married. I am ace and I’m in a long term relationship.

  • She might have her own opinion, regardless of whatever happens in season 8.

  • She could be trying to get those who are expecting Gendry and Arya rolling around on the floor of the forge to chill. Haha.

Even ignoring all of the subtext and their past interactions, I still find it very hard to believe they wouldn’t throw something our way. Those spin-offs they’re so desperately pushing require viewers wanting to commit to another several years of heartbreak.

So long as they both survive, I think we’ll at least have room to head canon. I highly doubt they’re gonna have some kind of Harry Potter 19 Years Later epilogue so it’s not like we’re going to find out who gets married and has children together, etc.
